p: Previous studies have used the size at first sexual maturity to set the size at first capture for fisheries management [ 58, 59]. Based on our findings, we recommend that this should be set at 18 cm. The sexual maturity rest period of S. maderensis should be established in relation to the spawning periods, particularly during spawning from June to October. To draw up a fishery management plan, biological and ecological studies should be expanded to include Mauritania, Gambia and Guinea Bissau. In addition, socio-economic and behavioral aspects of fishing communities must be understood to draw up a management plan that would be acceptable.
